title: Former Minnesota Governor Jesse Ventura Launches His Own Cannabis Brand, Fulfilling A ‘Lifelong Dream’
content: Minnesota’s former governor Jesse Ventura launching his own cannabis brand, fulfilling a “lifelong dream” by unveiling a line of hemp products.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Marijuana Rolling Paper Company Seeks Content Creator To ‘Get Paid To Smoke Weed’ For $70,420 Salary
content: A marijuana company specializing in manufacturing pre-rolled joints has launched a campaign to hire for what it calls the “ultimate stoner dream job,” seeking a content creator who will “get paid to smoke weed.”
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Nevada’s First Marijuana Consumption Lounge Officially Opens, With Top Lawmaker Hitting A Joint At 4:20
content: Nevada’s first legal marijuana consumption lounge has officially opened it doors, with a top local lawmaker smoking the inaugural joint at 4:20 pm.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Rapper Killer Mike Suggests Giving Black People Control Over Marijuana Industry As A Form Of Reparations
content: In a discussion about reparations on the HBO show Real Time With Bill Maher at the start of Black History Month on Friday, rapper Killer Mike suggested that Black people could be given control over America’s marijuana industry as a way to redress racial harm.
author: Ben Adlin

title: Brooklyn Nets And New York Liberty Become First NBA And WNBA Teams To Partner With CBD Company
content: The Brooklyn Nets and New York Liberty have entered into partnerships with a CBD beverage company—the first teams in the National Basketball Association (NBA) and Women’s National Basketball Association (WNBA), respectively, to forge deals with the cannabis industry.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: UFC Warns Fighters To Stop Using Marijuana ‘Immediately’ So They Aren’t Punished Under California Athletics Rules
content: The Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC) might have removed marijuana from its banned substances list for professional fighters—but a California athletics commission says they could still face penalties under state rules for testing positive for THC over a certain limit ahead of an upcoming event.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Treasury Secretary Yellen Says She Over-Prepared For First Time Using Marijuana And Jokes That It ‘Always Helps’ With Candy Crush
content: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen joked that smoking marijuana “always helps” when you “get stuck” on a difficult level of the mobile game Candy Crush—but in reality, she said she hasn’t used cannabis since the summer before attending Yale University, when she trained for her first session by smoking cigarettes.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: NFL Partnering On New Study Using CBD To Treat Pain And Protect From Concussions
content: The National Football League (NFL) is partnering with Canadian researchers on a clinical trial to test the safety and efficacy of CBD for pain management and neuroprotection from concussions—key issues for many football players who experience injuries as part of the game.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: NCAA Division I To Vote On Removing Marijuana From Banned Substances List For Student Athletes
content: A new collegiate athletics proposal would remove marijuana from the list of substances included in drug screenings for National Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA) championship competitions, with officials set to vote on the matter in June. Proponents say the approach is consistent with designing rules to focus on reducing harm rather than punishing student athletes.
author: Ben Adlin

title: UFC Formally Removes Marijuana From Banned Substances List For Professional Fighters
content: The Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC) announced on Thursday that it is formally removing marijuana from its newly modified banned substances list for athletes, building on an earlier reform.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: State Officials Promote Marijuana Gifting, Infused Baking And Safety Tips For The Holiday Season
content: State marijuana regulators across the country are marking the holiday season with messages about gifting cannabis as a present, making infused Christmas cookies and keeping products secure.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: States That Legalize Marijuana See Enhanced College Basketball Recruitment, Study Finds
content: Marijuana legalization is linked to significantly better recruitment for college basketball and worse outcomes for football teams, according to a new study.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Carnival Cruise Lines Denies That Anti-Marijuana Enforcement Measures Are Meant To Boost Alcohol Sales On Ships
content: Passenger cruise lines like Carnival and Royal Caribbean have policies against marijuana, noting that the substance is illegal in many ports it sails to and that they’re following federal law. But as more people return to the ships, and as more of them come from states where the drug is legal, operators are reportedly taking more extreme measures to detect cannabis and cracking down on people who attempt to use it—including those who simply pack CBD products, which are legal across the U.S.
author: Ben Adlin

title: SXSW Announces 2024 Lineup, Leaning Into Psychedelics While Nixing Cannabis Track
content: Organizers at SXSW this week unveiled a slate of more than 450 sessions chosen for the conference set to kick off in March. Among them are a handful of panels focused on legal marijuana and a whopping 13 sessions on psychedelics. It’s a sign of the shifting interest of the cutting edge conference as cannabis becomes more embedded into the mainstream and psychedelics emerge as the next big thing in drug policy.
author: Ben Adlin

title: Jimmy Kimmel Proclaims October 20—Snoop Dogg’s Birthday And Midpoint To 4/20—As New Marijuana Holiday Called ‘DoggFather’s Day’
content: Recognizing Snoop Dogg’s “significant contributions to the popularization of marijuana,” comedian and late-night TV host Jimmy Kimmel proclaimed the rapper’s birthday of October 20—this Friday—to be the “new high holiday” of DoggFather’s Day.
author: Ben Adlin

title: NCAA Panel Formally Recommends Removing Marijuana From Banned Substances List For College Athletes
content: A National Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA) committee is formally recommending that its divisional governing bodies remove marijuana from the list of banned substances list for college athletes.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Illinois Concert This Weekend Will Be State’s First To Allow On-Site Marijuana Consumption
content: Music fans heading to Mundelein, Illinois, this weekend will make history as part of the state’s first-ever concert to allow open marijuana consumption. Headliners, fittingly, include the cannabis-friendly artists Cypress Hill, Stephen Marley and Action Bronson.
author: Ben Adlin

title: World Anti-Doping Agency Experts Say Marijuana Use Violates The ‘Spirit Of Sport’ And Makes Athletes Unfit Role Models
content: Members of a World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA) panel say that marijuana use by athletes violates the “spirit of sport,” making them unfit role models whose potential impairment could put others at risk.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Americans View Marijuana As Safer Than Alcohol And Cigarettes As Rates Of Cannabis Use Surpass Tobacco Smoking, Gallup Poll Finds
content: Americans consider marijuana to be less harmful than alcohol, cigarettes, vapes and other tobacco products, according to new data from Gallup. And at the same time, cannabis use has “surpassed cigarette usage in the U.S., while vaping still trails both,” the polling firm says.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Fully Half Of American Adults Have Tried Marijuana, With Current Cannabis Smoking Outpacing Cigarettes, Gallup Poll Shows
content: Fully half of Americans have tried marijuana, according to a new Gallup poll—and more people now actively smoke cannabis than tobacco cigarettes. Additionally, a majority say they are not especially concerned about the effects of adults regularly using marijuana
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: SXSW Opens Voting On More Than 100 Marijuana And Psychedelics Panels For 2024 Festival
content: Voting is officially open for the 2024 South by Southwest (SXSW) festival—and this time, there are more than 100 marijuana and psychedelics panels that are up for consideration.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Bill Gates Tells Seth Rogen He Smoked Marijuana In High School ‘To Be Cool’
content: Microsoft founder Bill Gates says it’s “amazing” how marijuana policy and culture have evolved since his high school days smoking cannabis to fit in with his peers—and he thinks the ongoing federal-state marijuana law conflict has “got to be resolved.”
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Fetterman Shows Support For Wiz Khalifa As Rapper Gets ‘Stoned AF’ On Marijuana And Psilocybin To Throw Opening Pitch At MLB Game
content: Sen. John Fetterman (D-PA) tacitly endorsed rapper Wiz Khalifa’s plan to get “stoned af” on marijuana before throwing the ceremonial first pitch at a Pittsburgh Pirates game this week. But the artist’s plans apparently involved cannabis and psilocybin mushrooms.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Meta-Owned Social Media App Threads Directs Users To Drug Treatment Help When Searching Marijuana Or Psychedelics—But Not Alcohol Or Cigarettes
content: Threads, the new Meta-owned social media app that launched on Wednesday, is asking people if they want to “get help” finding drug treatment resources from a federal agency if they search for posts about “marijuana” or psychedelics like “psilocybin” or “ibogaine.” But searches for content about other drugs that are linked to serious addiction and death like alcohol and tobacco come with no such warning.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: CBD Company Sponsors Media Softball League With Teams From Wall Street Journal, BuzzFeed And More
content: The New York Media Softball League (NYMSL)—which has teams representing The Wall Street Journal, High Times and BuzzFeed among its ranks—is one of the latest athletic organizations to embrace the cannabis industry, launching a new sponsorship deal with a Kentucky-based CBD company.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: NBA Officially Signs Contract Removing Marijuana From Banned Substances List And Allowing Players To Invest In Cannabis Companies
content: The National Basketball Association (NBA) and its players union have officially signed a collective bargaining agreement that removes marijuana from the league’s banned substances list and lays out rules allowing players to invest in and promote cannabis brands—with certain exceptions.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: NFL Is Putting More Money Into Research On CBD As An Opioid Alternative For Players With Concussions
content: The National Football League (NFL) and its players union announced on Thursday that they are jointly awarding another round of funding to support independent research on the therapeutic benefits of CBD as a pain treatment alternative to opioids for players with concussions.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: NCAA Panel Recommends Removing Marijuana From Banned Substances List For College Athletes
content: A National Collegiate Athletics Association (NCAA) committee focused on promoting health and wellness for student athletes is proposing to remove marijuana from the organization’s banned substances list.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Amazon-Owned Twitch Bans Streamers From Promoting Marijuana But Allows Alcohol Branding In Policy Update
content: Video game streaming company Twitch has updated its branding policy for streamers, prohibiting promotions of marijuana businesses and products while explicitly allowing alcohol partnerships.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Kansas City Royals Become Second MLB Team To Partner With CBD Company
content: The Kansas City Royals formed a new partnership with a cannabis brand to promote education about the potential therapeutic benefits of CBD—the second Major League Baseball (MLB) team to do so.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: NBA Clarifies Players Won’t Be Able To Promote Marijuana Brands, But League Will Allow Passive Investments And End Testing
content: National Basketball Association (NBA) players will not be able to promote marijuana companies under a new collective bargaining agreement, contrary to early reports about the deal with the players union, a new summary document shows. But the league will remove drug testing requirements for THC, while allowing players to passively invest in the industry.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Nevada Sports Regulators Send Proposal To Stop Penalizing Fighters Over Marijuana To The Governor
content: Nevada sports regulators have voted to send a proposed regulatory amendment to the governor that would formally protect athletes from being penalized over using or possessing marijuana in compliance with state law.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Brands, Celebs And Organizations Celebrate The Marijuana Holiday 4/20 With New Campaigns And Products
content: It’s that time of year again—the unofficial marijuana holiday 4/20. And as has become tradition, a lot of brands, celebrities and organizations are leveraging the occasion to promote cannabis-themed campaigns and products.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: ACLU Defends Afroman In Lawsuit From Police Who Are Upset He Used Footage Of Their Marijuana Raid On His Home In Music Video
content: The American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU), along with the organization’s Ohio chapter, has filed a proposed amicus brief supporting Afroman in a civil lawsuit brought against him by seven police officers who are upset the hip hop artist used footage of their marijuana raid on his home in a music video.
author: Johnny Green

title: Snoop Dogg Applauds NBA For New Marijuana Policy, Saying Players Should Have Opioid Alternative
content: Marijuana icon Snoop Dogg is applauding the National Basketball Association (NBA) over reports that it plans to drop cannabis like it’s hot from the league’s banned substances list for players.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Nevada Sports Regulators Move To Formally Stop Penalizing Fighters Over Marijuana
content: Nevada sports regulators are considering amending their rules to formally protect athletes from being penalized over using or possessing marijuana in compliance with state law.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Chicago Cubs Become First MLB Team To Officially Partner With CBD Company
content: The Chicago Cubs is the first Major League Baseball (MLB) team to officially partner with a CBD company.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: NBA Will Let Players Invest In Marijuana Industry And Promote Cannabis Brands Under New Union Deal, According To Report
content: The National Basketball Association (NBA) isn’t just reportedly removing marijuana from its banned substances list for players—it’s also planning to let those players promote and invest in cannabis companies.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: The NBA Is Lifting Its Ban On Marijuana In New Deal With Players Union, According To Report
content: The National Basketball Association (NBA) is reportedly removing marijuana from its list of banned substances and will no longer drug test players for it as part of a new seven-year collective bargaining agreement.
author: Tom Angell

title: Jon Singleton Deserves An Apology From Major League Baseball For His Marijuana Suspensions (Opinion Column)
content: Professional athletes should be measured by their competitive abilities and the content of their character. They should never be measured by the presence of marijuana in their system. Unfortunately, many professional athletes over the years were subjected to the latter.
author: Johnny Green

title: Wiz Khalifa Urges People To Smoke Marijuana At Pennsylvania Governor’s Inauguration Party—Even Though It’s Not Legal There
content: Musicians, including rapper Wiz Khalifa, helped celebrate the inauguration of Pennsylvania’s new governor on Tuesday—and while it was a lighthearted affair, marijuana policy came up in subtle and less-than-subtle ways.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: One In Five People Who Are Ditching Alcohol For ‘Dry January’ Say They’re Using Cannabis As An Alternative, Survey Finds
content: About one in five people who are abstaining from alcohol as part of “Dry January” say they’re using cannabis as an alternative to help get through the month, according to a new survey.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Twitter Stops Suggesting People Who Search For ‘Marijuana’ May Need Drug Treatment
content: Twitter appears to have ended a federal partnership that had presented users who searched the site for certain drug-related keywords, including “marijuana,” with a suggestion they consider entering drug treatment. No such suggestion had appeared for “alcohol” searches.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Young Americans Are Twice As Likely To Smoke Marijuana Than Cigarettes, New Gallup Data Shows
content: Young people are now more than twice as likely to report smoking marijuana compared to cigarettes, according to a new analysis of survey data from Gallup.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Feds Tell National Park Visitors To Stop Licking Psychedelic Toads
content: The National Park Service (NPS) is cautioning people not to lick toads that secrete an alkaloid that produces psychedelic-like effects in humans.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: No, Schumer Is Not Seeking To Legalize Marijuana Use And Sales On Amtrak
content: Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-NY) might be a fan of riding Amtrak and an advocate for federal marijuana legalization—but a spokesperson for his office confirmed to Marijuana Moment on Thursday that he has not been working to broker a deal to let train passengers buy and use cannabis during their travel, despite the fact that some people have accepted the idea to be true after the fake news was published this week.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: SXSW Announces Marijuana And Psychedelics Panel Lineup For 2023 Festival
content: The 2023 South by Southwest (SXSW) panel lineup has officially been released, with a number of events focused on drug policy. And notably, next year’s festival will see more psychedelics panels than those centered on marijuana.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: NBA Won’t Test Players For Marijuana For Third Season In A Row, Report Says
content: For the third season in a row, the National Basketball Association (NBA) will reportedly not be randomly testing players for marijuana—a policy that insiders expect could become permanent.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Cannabis Company And Major League Baseball Sign Deal For Charlotte’s Web To Be ‘Official CBD of MLB’
content: Major League Baseball has signed a CBD company to serve as the league’s first-ever cannabis sponsor—with plans to promote the business at the upcoming World Series.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Marijuana Is Staying On The Banned Substances List For International Athletes, World Anti-Doping Agency Announces
content: The World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA) has officially decided to keep marijuana on the list of banned substances for international athletes following a scientific review and a determination that cannabis use “violates the spirit of sport.”
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Apple Lets Users Search For Marijuana And Pharmaceutical Interactions In Latest iPhone Health Update
content: The latest version of Apple’s iPhone software gives users an option to track medications and learn about possible drug interactions with other substances—including marijuana.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: World Anti-Doping Agency Set To Keep Marijuana On Banned Substance List, Saying U.S. Didn’t Back Its Removal
content: The World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA) seems poised to keep marijuana on the list of banned substances for athletes, despite a vociferous push for reform following the Olympics suspension of U.S. runner Sha’Carri Richardson over a positive cannabis test last year and the global body saying it would conduct a review of the drug’s status.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Mormon Bishop And Former GOP Utah Rep. Champions Ayahuasca After Faith-Affirming Psychedelic Experience
content: Although psychedelics policy reform has already found support across the ideological spectrum, a new ringing endorsement from an active Mormon bishop—who is also a former Republican Utah state representative—indicates an ever-growing acceptance for entheogens in American society.
author: Max Savage Levenson

title: Americans Say Marijuana Is Better For People And Society Than Alcohol, Gallup Poll Shows
content: More than twice as many Americans think that marijuana has a positive impact on its consumers and society at large than say the same about alcohol, according to a new Gallup poll.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: SXSW Opens Voting On Nearly 100 Marijuana And Psychedelics Panels For 2023 Festival
content: Voting is now open for the public to decide which panels will make the stage at next year’s South By Southwest (SXSW) festival—and there are about 100 marijuana- and psychedelics-related proposals to pick from.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: NBA Players’ Union Partners With Former Star Al Harrington On CBD Product Line To Be Sold By Amazon And Walmart
content: The NBA players’ union announced a new partnership on Tuesday to promote the sale of a line of CBD products from a business owned by a former star player that will be distributed through Walmart and Amazon.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: White House Affirms Brittney Griner Is ‘Wrongfully Detained’ After Guilty Plea In Russian Cannabis Case, Prompting Calls For Domestic Reform
content: The White House is maintaining that WNBA star Brittney Griner is “wrongfully detained” in Russia even after she pleaded guilty to unlawfully possessing cannabis vape cartridges in the country. But as American officials continue to seek her release, questions are being raised about whether federal marijuana prohibition in the U.S. is undermining its position in the case.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Neil deGrasse Tyson Wonders What Other Plants Can Get You High That People Just Haven’t Tried Smoking Yet
content: Neil deGrasse Tyson might be best known as an astrophysicist whose expertise lies in the cosmos beyond. But he says there may be mysteries yet to be unraveled here on earth when it comes to undiscovered plant life with psychedelic potential.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Florida Officials Announce Winners Of Student Hemp Innovation Essay Contest
content: The Florida Agriculture Department on Tuesday announced eight winners from students grades 5-11 who submitted essays on innovative uses for hemp as part of an annual “Agricultural History and Creativity” contest.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: California State Fair Announces Winners Of First-Ever State-Sanctioned Cannabis Competition
content: The California State Fair has unveiled the winners of a first-ever, state-sanctioned marijuana competition, awarding 60 trophies and medals to businesses whose products were judged based on lab testing for quality and cannabinoid profiles.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: MLB Teams Can Now Be Sponsored By CBD Companies, Baseball League Official Says
content: The MLB is now reportedly allowing baseball teams in the league to sell sponsorships to cannabis companies that market CBD products, as long as they meet certain criteria.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Connecticut Governor Jams To Country Song Celebrating Marijuana Legalization, Drawing Criticism From GOP Opponent
content: The governor of Connecticut is jamming to a new country song about all the good things about his state, including the fact that it’s “cool to smoke some pot” since he signed an adult-use legalization bill into law.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: New York Marijuana Regulators Ask TikTok To Stop Banning Cannabis Education Advertising
content: New York marijuana regulators are asking the social media app TikTok to end its ban on advertising that involves the word “cannabis” as they work to promote public education on the state’s move to legalize.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Marijuana Legalization ‘Drastically Changed’ Cannabis Marketing On Instagram, Study Finds
content: The marijuana legalization movement has “drastically changed” the social media landscape for cannabis marketing, according to a new research paper that focused on Instagram trends.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: David Letterman Recalls Smoking Marijuana And Being Mystified By Pitcher’s ‘Mound Of Dirt’ At Yankees Game
content: David Letterman once smoked a joint before a Yankees game and got so high that he doesn’t recall who won. But he does remember becoming fixated on the pitcher’s mound.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Delaware Governor And Congressional Lawmakers Condemn Drug-Related Search Of Student Athletes
content: The governor of Delaware and members of the state’s congressional delegation are speaking out after Georgia police pulled over a bus of college lacrosse players over an alleged traffic violation and searched their personal belongings in a fruitless attempt to find marijuana or other illicit drugs.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: American Basketball Star Brittney Griner ‘Wrongfully Detained’ Over Cannabis In Russia, U.S. Says While Maintaining Prohibition At Home
content: U.S. officials recently escalated their push for the release of WNBA player Brittney Griner, who was arrested in Russia in February after she was allegedly caught with cannabis vape cartridges at an airport.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Politicians And Government Agencies Celebrate 4/20 As Marijuana Legalization Movement Spreads
content: Wednesday marks the unofficial marijuana holiday known colloquially as 4/20—and there’s no deficit of politicians and government agencies hopping on the trend this year.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Brands, Celebs And Organizations Celebrate Marijuana Holiday 4/20 Amid Push For Federal Legalization
content: The unofficial marijuana holiday known as 4/20 has arrived again. And as more states have moved to end prohibition, more brands, celebrities and organizations are feeling emboldened to lean into the occasion with cannabis-centric deals, quips and campaigns.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Florida Officials Invite Students Grades 4-12 To Invent New Uses For Hemp As Part Of Essay Contest
content: Florida students from grades 4-12 are being invited to brainstorm new uses for hemp as part of an annual “Agricultural History and Creativity” contest being overseen by the state agriculture department.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: U.K. Lawyer Dons Vegan Hemp Wig As Alternative To Horsehair, Disrupting Centuries-Long Tradition
content: An attorney based in the U.K. is disrupting the centuries-long tradition of barristers wearing wigs made with horse hair. He wants lawyers in the country’s high courts to start donning vegan, hemp-based head coverings instead.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: More Americans Say It Would Be Better If People Used Marijuana Instead Of Alcohol, Poll Shows
content: More Americans think it’d be good if people switched to marijuana and drank less alcohol than think the substance substitution would be bad, according to a new poll.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: NCAA Moves To Lower Marijuana Penalties For Student Athletes And Increase THC Threshold In Drug Tests
content: Students athletes that are part of the NCAA would no longer automatically lose their eligibility to play following a positive marijuana test under rules that are being recommended by a key committee.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Sha’Carri Richardson, Suspended Over Marijuana, Suggests Racist Double Standard After Olympics Lets Russian Skater Compete Amid Doping Scandal
content: A U.S. sprinter who was suspended from competing in the 2021 summer Olympics over a positive marijuana test is challenging the recent decision to allow a Russian skater to continue to participate in this month’s winter games despite the discovery that she’d tested positive for a banned performance enhancement drug.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Marijuana Icon Willie Nelson Pushes For The Legalization Of ‘Comfort’ In Super Bowl Ad…For Shoes
content: Willie Nelson wants to legalize…comfort. And the artist and marijuana icon will be making the not-so-subtle case for a policy change in a Skechers commercial set to air during the Super Bowl on Sunday.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Twitch Says Marijuana-Themed Usernames Are Exempt From New Ban, Just Like Alcohol And Tobacco
content: The major video game streaming service Twitch says it’s cracking down on some unsavory usernames—but people whose handles reference marijuana are chill.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Weedmaps Ad Satirizes Plight Of Broccoli Emoji As Marijuana Stand-In On Social Media
content: The marijuana technology company Weedmaps released a satirical ad on Monday about a man dressed as broccoli who’s going through an identity crisis because people have come to associate the vegetable with cannabis.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: NFL Awards $1 Million To Study Marijuana Pain Management And Concussion Protection For Players
content: The NFL announced on Tuesday that it has authorized $1 million in grants for a pair of studies looking into the efficacy of marijuana and its components in managing football players’ pain and providing neuroprotection from concussions.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: SXSW Selects Multiple Marijuana And Psychedelics Panels For 2022 Festival
content: People who attend the 2022 South By Southwest (SXSW) festival will have the chance to hear from a range of experts and stakeholders on marijuana and psychedelics issues.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: One-Third Of Programmers Use Marijuana While Working, With Many Touting Creative Benefits, Study Finds
content: More than one-third of software programmers say they’ve used marijuana while working, with many finding that it helps promote creativity and get them into the “programming zone,” according to a new study.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Researcher Uses Reddit To Learn What Kinds Of Marijuana Posts Influenced Legalization Attitudes
content: Social media is a powerful tool in shaping political discourse, and a recent study that examined Reddit posts spanning over a decade sheds light on exactly what kinds of conversations may have influenced the public’s shift in support of marijuana legalization.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Rand Paul Mocks Democrats For Failing To Pass Marijuana Banking In Annual Festivus Grievances List
content: Sen. Rand Paul (R-KY) kept up his “Festivus” tradition on Thursday, marking the Seinfeld-popularized holiday with an airing of grievances that includes slamming Democrats for failing to advance marijuana banking reform despite having a congressional majority and control of the presidency.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: DEA Wants To Help Parents Decode The Emojis Young People Use To Discuss Marijuana And Other ‘Bomb Ass’ Drugs
content: The Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) says it’s cracked the code to identify what kind of emojis young people are using to talk about buying and selling illicit drugs.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Berlin Public Transit Is Selling Edible, Hemp-Infused Tickets To Help Riders To Relax This Holiday
content: Berlin’s public transit authority is hoping to take the stress out of holiday travel with promotional hemp-infused tickets that riders can eat.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Seth Rogen And Sarah Silverman Partner With Marijuana Businesses To Press Senators For Legalization
content: A coalition of marijuana advocacy and industry groups—as well as celebrities like Seth Rogen and Sarah Silverman—launched a campaign on Tuesday meant to encourage voters to reach out to their senators and demand action on legislation to federally legalize cannabis.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Singer Melissa Etheridge And Activist Van Jones Promote Psychedelics Reform As Movement Grows
content: The fight to end the criminalization of psychedelics and give patients access to natural plants and fungi has achieved success in a growing number of cities and states in recent years, and on Thursday the cause got a boost from prominent people in the entertainment and political fields.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Sanjay Gupta Explains His Marijuana Reversal And Discusses ‘Very Biased’ U.S. Research With Joe Rogan
content: CNN’s chief medical correspondent Sanjay Gupta wasn’t always on board with medical marijuana, but things changed when he looked for the science, he said during an interview on the Joe Rogan Experience on Wednesday.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Farmers Switch From Raising Chickens For Slaughter To Growing Hemp With Help Of Animal Advocacy Group
content: Some farmers are making a financial and ethical transition in the current economy that can be neatly summed up as going from hens to hemp.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: NBA Won’t Randomly Drug Test Players For Marijuana For Another Season, League Announces
content: The NBA is extending its policy of not randomly drug testing players for marijuana through the 2021-2022 season, a league spokesperson confirmed on Wednesday.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Elon Musk Says People Should Be ‘Open To Psychedelics’ And Predicts The Next Generation Of Politicians Will Normalize The Substances
content: Elon Musk might have his eyes set on Mars, but he says people should also be open to exploring internally with psychedelics.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: California State Fair Will Host Marijuana Competition For The First Time At 2022 Event, Officials Announce
content: California marijuana vendors will be able to take part in a first-of-its-kind, state-sanctioned cannabis competition at the State Fair next year, officials announced on Tuesday.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: World Anti-Doping Agency Reviews Marijuana Ban For Athletes Following Pushback On Richardson Suspension
content: The World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA) will conduct a scientific review of marijuana next year to determine whether it should continue an international ban on cannabis use by athletes.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Drake, Killer Mike And Other Celebs Push Biden To Issue Mass Marijuana Pardons
content: A group of more than 150 celebrities, athletes, politicians, law enforcement professionals and academics signed a letter that was delivered to President Joe Biden on Tuesday, urging him to issue a “full, complete and unconditional pardon” to all people with non-violent federal marijuana convictions.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Biden Opposes Marijuana Legalization Because He’s From The ‘Reefer Madness Generation,’ Neil deGrasse Tyson Says
content: Neil deGrasse Tyson isn’t necessarily surprised that President Joe Biden is opposed to legalizing marijuana. He is, after all, part of the “Reefer Madness generation,” the astrophysicist said.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Medical Marijuana Saved Former NFL Player From ‘Downward Spiral,’ He Tells Louisiana Lawmakers
content: “I felt it was worth the risk of committing a crime… I felt good physically and my head was much clearer. I felt free—free from the downward spiral.”
author: Marijuana Moment

title: Snoop Dogg Says Sports Leagues Should Let Athletes Use Marijuana Instead Of Opioids
content: Sports leagues need to stop testing players for marijuana and allow to them to use it as an alternative to prescription opioids, cannabis icon Snoop Dogg said on Monday.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Sha’Carri Richardson Says She’d Be ‘Blessed’ If Her Marijuana Suspension Led To End Of The Ban For Other Athletes
content: U.S. sprinter Sha’Carri Richardson is hopeful that her suspension from participating in the Olympics after testing positive for marijuana will lead to an international policy change for athletes, and she says she would be “blessed” if that happens as a result of her punishment.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: NBA Star Kevin Durant Teams Up With Weedmaps To Destigmatize Marijuana In Sports
content: The online marijuana marketplace Weedmaps is teaming up with NBA star Kevin Durant for a multi-year partnership that’s aimed at destigmatizing cannabis and showcasing the plant’s potential value for “athlete wellness and recovery.”
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Rosario Dawson Joins Board Of Marijuana Business As Partner Cory Booker Pushes For Legalization In Senate
content: Actress Rosario Dawson is joining the board of a California-based marijuana beverage company as her partner, Sen. Cory Booker (D-NJ), is pushing to build support for a bill he’s sponsoring to federally legalize cannabis.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Half Of Americans Have Tried Marijuana, New Gallup Poll Finds
content: Nearly half of American adults have tried marijuana, according to a new poll from Gallup, and more than one in ten say they actively smoke cannabis.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: New Yorkers Can Smoke Marijuana At This Year’s State Fair Post-Legalization, Officials Confirm
content: The New York State Fair will be a little different—and a lot more marijuana friendly—this year.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Colorado Governor Gives South Park Creators Marijuana-Themed License Plates Honoring ‘Tegridy’
content: The governor of Colorado on Friday presented the creators of South Park with souvenir license plates that pay homage to the fictional marijuana company Tegridy Farms that’s featured in multiple episodes of the comedy series. And he said one of the show’s most popular stoner characters would make a good mascot for the state.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: SXSW Wants You To Vote On Dozens Of Marijuana And Psychedelics Panels For 2022 Event
content: The annual South By Southwest (SXSW) festival has become a hub for conversations around marijuana and psychedelics in recent years—and voting is now open for people to decide exactly what kinds of discussions they hope to hear on the issue at next year’s event.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Neil deGrasse Tyson Has Questions About Animals Eating Psychedelic Mushrooms And People Tripping On Infected Cicadas
content: Neil deGrasse Tyson has a lot of questions about psychedelic mushrooms—including whether non-human animals willingly partake in the experience and whether eating enough cicadas infected by hallucinogenic fungi would create a psychoactive effect.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Another Top Global Sports Official Suggests Marijuana Penalties For Athletes Should Be Reevaluated
content: The head of the international track and field organization World Athletics has joined the choir of sports officials who are calling for an reevaluation of marijuana penalties for Olympic athletes following the suspension of U.S. runner Sha’Carri Richardson over a positive cannabis test.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: U.S. Sports Authority Backs ‘Liberalization’ Of Marijuana Laws, Official Tells Lawmakers
content: A representative of the U.S. Anti-Doping Agency (USADA) this week shifted blame for the Olympics suspension of U.S. runner Sha’Carri Richardson over a positive marijuana test, saying the national sports organization is “heartbroken” over the case and supports “liberalization” of current bans but claiming that its hands are tied with respect to enforcing international drug policy.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: World Anti-Doping Agency Says U.S. Bears Responsibility For Marijuana Ban That Led To Richardson’s Suspension
content: The World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA) is making clear that the U.S. has played a key role in placing marijuana on the list of prohibited substances for international athletes—and it still has a seat at the table if it wants a policy change.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Top U.S. Sports Regulator Says Marijuana Policy ‘Must Change’ As White House Pursues Global Meeting
content: The rules on marijuana for international athletes “must change,” the U.S. Anti-Doping Agency (USADA) said in a response letter to members of Congress on Friday following the suspension of runner Sha’Carri Richardson over a positive cannabis test. Separately, the White House is now reportedly seeking a meeting with international sports regulators to discuss the policy.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: White House And U.S. Anti-Doping Agency Criticize Marijuana Ban After Richardson Suspension
content: A growing choir of prominent voices are calling for a reevaluation of Olympics policies that punish athletes for marijuana after U.S. runner Sha’Carri Richardson was suspended over a positive test. Now, the White House press secretary and the U.S. Anti-Doping Agency (USADA) are suggesting it may be time for change.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Nevada Sports Regulators Ditch Marijuana Penalties For Fighters, Days After Richardson’s Olympics Suspension
content: At a time when drug testing policy in sports is under sharp, national scrutiny, Nevada sports regulators voted on Wednesday to make it so athletes will no longer be penalized over a positive marijuana test.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: USA Track And Field Team Says Marijuana Punishments ‘Should Be Reevaluated’ Following Richardson Suspension
content: A positive marijuana test cost star U.S. runner Sha’Carri Richardson a shot at a key Olympic race this month. And now the nation’s governing body on track and field is saying international policy on cannabis punishments athletes “should be reevaluated.”
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Women Oppose Sha’Carri Richardson’s Marijuana Suspension While Men Support It, Poll Finds
content: There’s been widespread condemnation over the United States Anti-Doping Agency’s (USADA) recent decision to suspend U.S. runner Sha’Carri Richardson from at least some Olympic competition over a failed marijuana test. But according to a new poll, women are notably more likely to oppose the suspension than men are.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Conan O’Brien Celebrates Retirement By Smoking Marijuana With Seth Rogen On TV
content: After a decades-long career in late-night television, Conan O’Brien is retiring. And the host is cutting loose, smoking a joint with famed marijuana enthusiast Seth Rogen on Tuesday.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: NFL Funds Marijuana Research As Federal Prohibition ‘Adversely’ Impacts Studies Into Opioid Alternative For Players
content: A commission formed between the NFL and the league’s players union plans to award up to $1 million in grants for researchers to investigate the therapeutic potential of marijuana, CBD and other alternatives to opioids for treating pain.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: How Politicians Are Celebrating The Marijuana Holiday 4/20 This Year
content: The country has come a long way since the days of politicians dismissing or shying away from marijuana issues. And a good example of that shift is the ever-growing number of lawmakers who are leaning into the cannabis holiday 4/20 with calls for reform.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Free Marijuana For Vaccinations And Cannabis Dog Toys: How Brands Are Celebrating 4/20 This Year
content: Marijuana advocates and enthusiasts have a lot to celebrate on this year’s unofficial cannabis holiday 4/20.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Colorado Is Auctioning Marijuana-Themed License Plates To Raise Money For People With Disabilities
content: Colorado is really leaning into its reputation as the marijuana state—for a good cause. Officials are taking the unique step of auctioning off cannabis-themed license plates to help raise money for a disability fund.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Seth Rogen’s Marijuana Biz Expands To U.S. While Jay-Z Gets Political With Cannabis Ad Campaign
content: Monday was a big day in the celebrity marijuana space, with actor Seth Rogen announcing the U.S. launch of his cannabis brand and rapper Jay-Z revealing an ad campaign for his company that’s meant to highlight the absurdity of the war on drugs by pointing out that some states are more lax on cousin marriage, cannibalism or sex with farm animals than they are on weed.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: NFL Explores How Marijuana And CBD Can Be Used As Opioid Alternatives For Players
content: The National Football League and NFL Players Association are launching an effort to learn about the potential of marijuana and its components like CBD as alternative treatment options for pain.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Elon Musk Thinks CBD Is ‘Fake,’ But Joe Rogan Teaches Him A Lesson
content: Elon Musk might know a thing or two about rockets and electronic vehicles, but during an interview with podcaster Joe Rogan this week, he revealed something of a blind spot when it comes to cannabis, saying he thinks CBD is “fake.”
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Sierra Club Gives Tips On Using Marijuana In An Environmentally Friendly Way
content: A leading environmental conservationist group wants to help you sustainably and safely consume marijuana.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Killer Mike Challenges Joe Biden To Adopt Bernie Sanders’s Marijuana Legalization Plan
content: Rapper and activist Killer Mike is challenging President-elect Joe Biden to take a note from Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-VT) and use executive authority to broadly reform federal marijuana laws as soon as he takes office.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: NBA Could Permanently End Marijuana Tests So It Doesn’t Become ‘Big Brother,’ Commissioner Says
content: A temporary NBA policy not to randomly drug test players for marijuana may well become permanent, the league’s commissioner said this week.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: NBA Players Won’t Be Tested For Marijuana Next Year As League Weighs Permanent Change
content: The NBA is extending its policy of not randomly drug testing players for marijuana for the 2020-2021 season amid the coronavirus pandemic. And insiders suspect that the relaxed cannabis rules will continue indefinitely.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: SXSW Wants You To Vote On Marijuana And Psychedelics Panels For 2021 Event
content: Dozens of marijuana-related panels have been proposed for next year’s South by Southwest (SXSW) event, and several other submissions mention psychedelics. Now the festival needs the public’s help in deciding which ones make the cut.
author: Ben Adlin

title: Feds Cite Marijuana Comments By Seth Rogen, Joe Rogan And Other Celebs In COVID PSA Database
content: The Trump administration appears to have considered celebrities’ views on marijuana legalization and drug use to be relevant factors when selecting spokespeople to participate in a public education campaign on coronavirus prevention, internal documents show.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Schools And NCAA Could Ban Marijuana Sponsorships Under Bill To Let Student Athletes Monetize Their Success
content: A new bipartisan congressional bill aimed at helping student athletes monetize their success contains a provision that would let colleges and intercollegiate organizations block them from making sponsorship deals with marijuana businesses.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Musician John Legend Endorses Drug Decriminalization Ballot Measure In Oregon
content: Musician John Legend on Friday endorsed an Oregon initiative to decriminalize possession of all currently illicit drugs while investing in substance misuse treatment.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Colorado Governor Tells Texas Not To Legalize Marijuana So His Own State Can Get More Tourists
content: The governor of Colorado is jokingly discouraging Texas from legalizing marijuana, saying it would mean less tax revenue for his own state from cannabis tourism.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Launch Of Maine’s Legal Marijuana Sales Inspires Rambling Police Department Facebook Post
content: A member of a local Maine police department has some thoughts about the state’s newly launched marijuana retail system. In fact, he has a lot of thoughts—and he laid them all out in a rambling 1,400-word Facebook post on Saturday. The diatribe touches on everything from Phish festivals to drug-sniffing dogs to the medical benefits of cannabis to sweet chili Doritos.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Dave Chappelle’s Marijuana And Psychedelics Parties Don’t Concern Local Sheriff
content: Comedian Chris Rock spilled the beans on behind-the-scenes festivities at Dave Chappelle’s recent comedy shows, telling Ellen DeGeneres that the parties have included “way more weed than anyone should ever have” as well as “a lot of mushrooms.”
author: Ben Adlin

title: Filmmaker Kevin Smith Promotes Marijuana Legalization Referendum In New Jersey
content: Filmmaker Kevin Smith isn’t trying to convince New Jersey residents who should get their vote for president this November—but he does want voters in his home state to support a marijuana legalization referendum that will appear on the ballot.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Twitter Partners With Feds On Campaign Flagging ‘Marijuana’ Searches While Giving ‘Alcohol’ A Pass
content: Twitter is partnering with a federal drug agency to promote substance misuse treatment resources when users of the social media platform search for “marijuana” or certain other substance-related keywords—but no such health warning appears with results for alcohol-connected terms.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Drone Drops Hundreds Of Free Bags Of Marijuana In Israel
content: Marijuana fell from the sky in Israel on Thursday, with a drone dropping hundreds of small bags of cannabis in the streets of Tel Aviv.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: President Carter Talks About His Son Smoking Marijuana At The White House With Willie Nelson
content: In a new documentary being released this month, Former President Jimmy Carter (D) discusses the time his son smoked marijuana at the White House with musician Willie Nelson during his administration.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Elephant Will Be Given CBD To Treat Stress After Death Of Companion, Zoo Says
content: A zoo in Poland announced it will give CBD to an elephant in hopes of alleviating stress she’s experienced since one of her companions died.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Poll Reveals Which Sports Fans Use Marijuana And CBD The Most And Least
content: Fans of e-sports, the UFC and racing are the most likely to use marijuana or CBD, according to a survey released on Friday. The least cannabis-friendly sports fans are those who watch baseball, golf and football.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Seth Rogen’s Advice On Ending COVID: ‘Smoke Weed And Watch Movies’
content: Actor Seth Rogen is urging young people to stay home and smoke marijuana rather than risk spreading the coronavirus by going out—and he’s getting praise for his recommendation from a top Canadian politician.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Dr. Oz Claims DEA And FDA Blame Each Other For Keeping Marijuana Illegal
content: According to celebrity doctor Mehmet Oz—or Dr. Oz—representatives from the Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) and Food and Drug Administration (FDA) have each told him they’re on board with legalizing marijuana. And the agencies blame each other for blocking efforts to end prohibition.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Don’t Drive High On Marijuana Even If You’re Being Chased By An Axe Murderer, Federal PSA Says
content: The latest push by the federal government to deter marijuana-impaired driving is coming to TV, radio and the web. Its message? Even if you’re being chased by an axe-wielding psychopath, it’s not worth driving high.
author: Ben Adlin

title: HBO Teams Up With Marijuana Companies To Sell THC Gummies Promoting New TV Series
content: HBO is partnering up with major marijuana businesses to market a line of promotional cannabis edible gummies meant to bring attention to an animated series premiering next week, the entertainment giant announced on Monday.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Just Look At These Hemp Shoes The VA Is Selling To Military Veterans
content: The U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) is selling pairs of aesthetically questionable hemp toe shoes to military veterans.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Creator Of Christian Children’s Show VeggieTales Slams Racial Injustices Of War On Drugs
content: The founder of the popular Christian-themed children’s show VeggieTales recently gave a thorough lecture on the role of the war on drugs in the racial injustices fueling protests across the country.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Library Of Congress Highlights Racist News Coverage Used To Justify Criminalizing Marijuana A Century Ago
content: The Library of Congress (LOC) is documenting racist depictions of marijuana in early 20th century news coverage that helped to drive the criminalization of cannabis, highlighting sensationalized articles about the plant that the federal research body says effectively served as “anti-Mexican propaganda.”
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: NBA Players Union Head Joins Marijuana Company As League Reportedly Suspends Drug Testing
content: The head of the NBA’s players union is joining the board of a major marijuana company at the same time reports are surfacing that players will not be tested for cannabis and other recreational drugs when they convene to wrap up the season in Orlando next month.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Rapper Who Owns Looted Marijuana Dispensary Says Justice Is More Important Than Business
content: One marijuana dispensary owner whose business was caught in the chaos stemming from the reaction to rampant police violence over the weekend says he values life and justice over his stolen cannabis merchandise.
author: Lindsey Bartlett

title: Missouri Lawmakers Defeat Amendment To Require They Consume Marijuana Before Voting
content: Missouri lawmakers rejected an amendment to a health care bill on Thursday that would have required House members to consume a “substantial” amount of marijuana before performing their legislative duties.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Marijuana Bumper Stickers? No Thanks, Drivers Say In National Survey
content: Even as a growing number of states are enacting legalization laws, stigma around marijuana is alive and well in the United States—at least according to a recent survey about the kinds of bumper stickers America’s drivers are willing to put on their vehicles.
author: Ben Adlin

title: Police Departments In Legal And Illegal Marijuana States Play Into 4/20 With Jokes And Puns
content: In legal marijuana states and those that maintain prohibition alike, police departments evidently wanted to get some giggles on the marijuana holiday 4/20.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Here’s What Celebrities And Organizations Are Saying About Marijuana On 4/20
content: Celebrities and various organizations aren’t letting the coronavirus pandemic stop them from celebrating or otherwise acknowledging the marijuana holiday 4/20.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Ben & Jerry’s Uses 4/20 To Promote Marijuana Reform While Other Brands Market Off The Holiday
content: This year, the marijuana holiday 4/20 is being disrupted across the board due to the coronavirus pandemic and resulting social distancing measures.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Congressional Candidates Openly Grow And Smoke Marijuana To Get Through Coronavirus Isolation
content: If congressional candidate Amanda Siebe is any indication, the next class of Congress could be the most transparently pro-marijuana in history, embracing not just legislative reform but also the culture of cannabis as consumers and patients.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: How To Celebrate The 4/20 Marijuana Holiday Virtually This Year Amid COVID Social Distancing
content: The marijuana holiday 4/20 is going to be a little different this year as the world grapples with the coronavirus pandemic, prompting orders to avoid public gatherings and take social distancing measures.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Lawmakers Mourn Loss Of Charlotte Figi, Whose Story Inspired National CBD Movement And Helped Change Policies
content: Advocates and lawmakers are mourning the loss of a young icon in the medical marijuana reform movement. Charlotte Figi, who showed the world how CBD can treat severe epilepsy, passed away on Tuesday at the age of 13 due to complications from a likely coronavirus infection.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Marijuana Was In 100-Year-Old Medical Cabinet On Antiques Roadshow, But Owner’s Brother Smoked It
content: In the late 1800s, it wasn’t uncommon for doctors to lawfully possess marijuana as part of a medical kit. And at a recent antique show, one person gave a glimpse of how that cannabis was stored.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Two Marijuana Magazines Owned By High Times Suspend Publication Due To Coronavirus
content: The company behind High Times is temporarily suspending the publication of two print cannabis magazines it owns due to difficulties with the supply chain that have arisen due to the coronavirus outbreak, Hightimes Holding Corp. confirmed to Marijuana Moment on Monday.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Former NFL Player Under Fire For Claiming CBD Can Cure Coronavirus
content: Former NFL player Kyle Turley believes CBD can prevent and cure coronavirus—and he’s not backing down on that clinically unsubstantiated claim despite pushback from marijuana legalization supporters and prohibitionists alike.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Americans Want Medical Marijuana Dispensaries To Stay Open As ‘Essential Services,’ Poll Finds
content: A majority of Americans believe that medical cannabis dispensaries should be kept open as “essential services” amid the coronavirus pandemic, according to a new poll.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Stop Passing That Joint, Top Marijuana Reform Group Says Amid Coronavirus
content: As the new coronavirus continues to spread through the U.S., one of the country’s leading advocacy groups for marijuana legalization is warning consumers to stop passing joints and to beware of online misinformation, including “any claims cannabis or CBD can help cure or protect against this virus.”
author: Ben Adlin

title: Filmmaker Kevin Smith Requests Digital Signatures For Marijuana Initiative Due To Coronavirus
content: As the coronavirus outbreak continues to spread, filmmaker Kevin Smith and actor Jason Mewes are asking California officials to allow digital signature gathering for a marijuana initiative that a campaign is hoping to qualify for the November ballot.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: New NFL Policy Would End Suspensions For Testing Positive For Any Drug—Not Just Marijuana
content: NFL players would not face the possibility of being suspended from games over positive tests for any drug—not just marijuana—under a collective bargaining agreement that has been approved by team owners and is now being voted on by members of the players union.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Baseball Players Can Smoke Marijuana But Can’t Be Sponsored By Cannabis Companies, MLB Says
content: With spring training now in full swing, Major League Baseball is further clarifying its stance on marijuana. Players can now consume cannabis without risk of discipline, the league explained in a new memo, but they can’t show up to work under the influence and—at least for now—are barred from entering into commercial arrangements with companies in the marijuana industry.
author: Ben Adlin

title: NFL Would End Marijuana Suspensions In Deal Approved By Team Owners
content: National Football League players would no longer face the possibility of being suspended from games just for testing positive for marijuana under a proposed collective bargaining agreement approved by team owners and circulated to players on Thursday.
author: Tom Angell

title: NFL Marijuana Penalties Will Be ‘Dramatically Reduced’ Under Deal Being Weighed By Players Union
content: The NFL Players Association could soon vote on an agreement with the league that includes sharply reduced penalties for marijuana use by football players and dramatically shortens the annual window during which they may be tested for cannabis and other drugs.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Netflix Blocks Marijuana Shows And Films In Response To Government Demands
content: Film and television, for many of us, were the first places we saw cannabis users humanized.
author: Alexander Lekhtman

title: NFL Says ‘Hype’ Over CBD Isn’t Backed By Science
content: An expert panel created by the National Football League (NFL) and its players union is downplaying the potential benefits of CBD for players, stating that while the cannabis compound shows promise in the treatment of some forms of pain, the science doesn’t currently live up to the “hype.”
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Sarah Silverman Calls Out Dave Chappelle For Not Sharing His Marijuana
content: Dave Chappelle is a marijuana bogart, Sarah Silverman revealed at an award ceremony honoring the fellow comedian.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Dave Chappelle And Aziz Ansari Took Magic Mushrooms To Celebrate Comedy Award
content: When comedian Dave Chappelle wins a prestigious award, he opts for psychedelics over champagne to celebrate, fellow comedian Aziz Ansari said
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Elon Musk Makes Marijuana Joke After Tesla’s Stock Hits $420
content: Telsa CEO Elon Musk found it really amusing that his company’s stock hit $420 per share on Monday.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Top NFL Owner And Player Expect Marijuana Policy Change Following MLB Action
content: A top National Football League (NFL) team owner and a star player said this week that they’re expecting changes to the league’s marijuana policy after the MLB announced it is removing cannabis from the banned substances list for baseball players.
author: Lindsey Bartlett

title: MLB Officially Removes Marijuana From Banned Substances List For Baseball Players
content: Major League Baseball (MLB) and the MLB players union announced on Thursday that they have reached an agreement to remove marijuana from the list of banned substances and will begin to treat its consumption by players in the same way that  alcohol use is handled.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: MLB Plans To Remove Marijuana From Banned Substances List For Minor Leaguers
content: Major League Baseball (MLB) is making a bold move to address opioids and remove marijuana from its banned substances list for minor league players.
author: Lindsey Bartlett

title: Willie Nelson Will ‘Never Stop Enjoying’ Marijuana Despite Quitting Smoking, Son Says
content: Marijuana enthusiasts around the world have been shocked by the news that Willie Nelson no longer smokes cannabis. Cue the “Has hell frozen over?” jokes.
author: Lindsey Bartlett

title: Postal Service Unveils ‘Drug Free USA Forever’ Stamp Commemorating 1980s Anti-Drug Program
content: The U.S. Postal Service (USPS) is rolling out a new stamp design that pays tribute to 1980s-era drug prevention programs and promotes a “drug-free USA.”
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Doctors Find Marijuana In Man’s Nose That He’d Forgotten Smuggling Into Prison 18 Years Ago
content: After a man attempted to smuggle a small amount of marijuana inside a balloon stuffed in his nose into prison, he thought he accidentally swallowed it and that the cannabis ended up passing through his body.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: SXSW Announces Two Dozen Marijuana Panels For 2020 Festival
content: South by Southwest (SXSW) revealed the festival’s 2020 lineup this week, and it includes 24 panels dedicated exclusively to cannabis issues.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Snoop Dogg Has A Salaried Marijuana Blunt Roller On Staff
content: Snoop Dogg pays a person between $40,000-$50,000 per year to roll blunts for him, he said during a recent appearance on The Howard Stern Show.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Police Ask Florida Man To Stop Calling 911 About His Stolen Marijuana
content: A Florida sheriff’s department had to ask a man to stop repeatedly calling 911 to report his roommate allegedly stealing $20 worth of marijuana this weekend.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Seth Rogen And Snoop Dogg Offer Marijuana Advice To First-Time Consumers
content: Seth Rogen and Snoop Dogg have some advice for first-time marijuana consumers: if you bump into them and want to sesh, limit yourself to one hit—or even half a hit.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Breaking Bad Teams Up With Marijuana Company MedMen To Promote New Netflix Film
content: Fans of AMC’s “Breaking Bad” are being taken on a scavenger hunt as part of an advertising campaign for the show’s upcoming Netflix feature, “El Camino.” And the first clue sent people to a MedMen marijuana dispensary in Los Angeles on Sunday.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: South Park Slams MedMen In Episode About Banning Marijuana Home Cultivation
content: South Park took another hit at the marijuana dispensary chain MedMen in an episode that aired on Wednesday.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Marijuana Enthusiast Seth Rogen Releases PSA Promoting National Expungement Week
content: Actor Seth Rogen is helping to spread the word about how to get criminal records cleared as part of the second annual National Expungement Week (NEW) initiative.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: California Lawmakers Use Cryptocurrency To Buy Marijuana From Dispensary
content: Two city councilmembers in California became the first elected officials to use cryptocurrency to purchase marijuana from a dispensary—at least publicly—on Tuesday.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Seth Rogen Hosting Marijuana-Fueled Charity Carnival For Alzheimer’s Research
content: Actor Seth Rogen will be the ringmaster at an adults-only charity carnival next month featuring comedians running game booths and marijuana aplenty.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Disneyland Busted Robert Downey Jr. For Smoking Marijuana, He Reveals While Accepting Disney Award
content: Robert Downey Jr. said he was once detained at Disneyland after getting caught smoking marijuana on a gondola ride.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Dave Chappelle Ate Magic Mushrooms Gifted By A Stranger, Joe Rogan Says
content: Comedian Dave Chappelle recently rented out a movie theater at 1:00 AM and took psilocybin mushrooms that a stranger handed him.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Here Are The Top 20 Most And Least Marijuana-Friendly U.S. Colleges
content: It’s back-to-school season, and as college students get ready to move into their dorms, some might be wondering about campus culture—including whether their school is marijuana friendly.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: More Than 150 Proposed SXSW Marijuana Panels Are Being Voted On For Next Year’s Festival
content: More than 150 different marijuana-focused panels are up for consideration to be featured at next year’s South by Southwest (SXSW) festival and its related SWSW EDU event.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Young Americans Are More Likely To Smoke Marijuana Than Cigarettes, Poll Finds
content: American adults are nearly as likely to smoke marijuana as cigarettes, a new Gallup poll finds, with consumption of the latter at a 75-year low.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Watch: Bear’s Failed Attempt To Burglarize Marijuana Dumpster Proves Regulations Work
content: A bear in Lyons, Colorado tried and failed to break into a dumpster behind a marijuana dispensary last week—inadvertently making a strong case for the efficacy of the state’s cannabis regulations.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: South Park Seems To Take A Jab At Marijuana Company MedMen In Satirical Ad
content: South Park took a jab at corporate marijuana in a clip released over the weekend—seemingly riffing off a slick ad that  MedMen published earlier this year—while promoting a fictional cannabis brand called “Tegridy Farms.”
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: SXSW Wants You To Submit Marijuana Panel Ideas For 2020 Event
content: South by Southwest (SXSW) is soliciting ideas for marijuana-related panels to be featured at next year’s festival.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Tom Hanks Denies Fake Quote Promoting CBD Company
content: Actor Tom Hanks wants you to know that he is not, in fact, feeling like a new person after using a CBD product from a California-based cannabis company.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Several Grateful Dead Members Call On Fans To Support Marijuana Reform
content: Three founding members of The Grateful Dead and a member of the spinoff group Dead & Company used part of their Independence Day to promote marijuana reform.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Professional Golfer Suspended For Medical Cannabis Asks PGA To Drop Marijuana Ban
content: A professional golfer who received a three-month suspension after testing positive for THC in March is making the case to remove cannabis from the Professional Golfers’ Association (PGA) list of banned substances.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Mick Jagger Gives Illinois Governor A Shout Out For Legalizing Marijuana
content: Rock icon Mick Jagger gave the governor of Illinois a shout out for signing a bill to legalize marijuana on Tuesday.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Killer Mike Explains Why Rappers Deserve More Credit For Marijuana Legalization
content: Rapper and social justice advocate Killer Mike said on Monday that it’s important for Americans to recognize that rap artists helped pave the path to marijuana reform in a way that isn’t often discussed in the media.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Americans Want CBD Available Over-The-Counter, Poll Finds
content: A majority of Americans familiar with cannabidiol (CBD) say it should be available as an over-the-counter drug and that the compound has multiple health benefits, according to a Gallup survey released on Friday.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Oakland Marijuana Shop Flooded With Questions About Psilocybin Mushrooms After Decriminalization Vote
content: A vote to decriminalize psilocybin mushrooms and other psychedelics in Oakland has left some residents confused about whether the substances have become commercially available.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Spray Marijuana Mist On North Korea And Iran To Solve Nuclear Crisis, C-SPAN Caller Says
content: Katherine from New Hampshire has a novel idea to stave off nuclear war: fly over sites where the weapons are being developed and release a marijuana mist so that the workers will “chill out” and lose interest in creating the missiles.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: ‘I Can’t Breathe’: Video Shows Grandmother With Arthritis Arrested For CBD At Disney World
content: Police released body camera footage of a 69-year-old woman being arrested at a Florida amusement park for possessing CBD oil without a state medical cannabis card on Tuesday.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Presidential Candidate Jokes About Why Denver Decriminalized Psychedelic Mushrooms
content: Sen. Michael Bennet (D-CO) joked on Thursday that Denver voters approved a measure to decriminalize psychedelic mushrooms because they thought the state of Colorado was running low on marijuana.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Horses Should Lay Off CBD, Equestrian Sports Regulator Says
content: Hay is for horses, but CBD isn’t.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Jeopardy Contestants Are Getting Tested On Their Marijuana And LSD Knowledge
content: In another sign of the times, contestants on the wholesome, long-running game show Jeopardy have been challenged to answer questions about drugs like marijuana and LSD on at least three occasions in the past several weeks.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Facebook Uses Marijuana And Broccoli To Show Off Its AI Tech
content: Marijuana buds and tempura broccoli can look oddly similar out of context, but Facebook’s artificial intelligence (AI) technology can tell the difference.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Lots Of Politicians And Companies Are Tweeting About Marijuana On 4/20
content: It’s 4/20 again, and that means another slew of tweets from politicians and mainstream brands looking to use the marijuana holiday as a hook to get their message out.
author: Tom Angell

title: Ben & Jerry’s Stands Out From Companies Just Trying To Make Money From 4/20
content: Ben & Jerry’s wants to remind people this 4/20 that hundreds of thousands of people are still getting arrested for non-violent marijuana offenses.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Congressional Democrats Compete In Marijuana-Themed Trivia Game
content: Democratic members of Congress scored points for correctly answering questions about marijuana during a trivia game at a retreat they participated in last week.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Seth Rogen Talks About Taking Magic Mushrooms At Cirque du Soleil
content: Actor Seth Rogen takes his movie roles very seriously. So when he was asked to scout filming locations in Las Vegas for a “Knocked Up” scene where he and Paul Rudd take magic mushrooms at a Cirque du Soleil performance, Rogen and co-producer Evan Goldberg didn’t cut corners.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Michigan Governor Celebrates Marijuana Legalization In Video For Hash Bash Event
content: This weekend’s 48th annual Hash Bash event received the blessing of Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer (D), who released a video statement supporting the gathering and touting the state’s legal cannabis program.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: PGA Issues Warning To Golfers Using CBD Products
content: The PGA Tour is warning golfers to use CBD at their own risk.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Legalization Advocates Create Hoax ‘Elite’ New York Marijuana Club In Push For Social Equity
content: It was billed as an elite, members-only marijuana social club. But the advertisements for Country Club Cannabis, which popped up on social media feeds and in advertisements across New York City this week, were all part of a deliberately provocative campaign launched by the Drug Policy Alliance (DPA).
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Marijuana Activists Protest John Boehner’s SXSW Speech
content: Advocates for social equity in the increasingly legal marijuana economy are protesting keynote speeches by former Republican House Speaker John Boehner and MedMen CEO Adam Bierman at South by Southwest (SXSW).
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Marijuana Tourism From China To Amsterdam: Study Sheds Light On Motivations
content: Marijuana use in China is strictly forbidden. In fact, when Canada legalized cannabis last year, the Chinese government sternly reminded its citizens living in or visiting the country to “please avoid contact or using marijuana.”
author: Kimberly Lawson

title: Congressman Talks Cannabis With ‘Captain America’
content: Actor Chis Evans of “Captain America” fame met with Rep. Earl Blumenauer (D-OR) on Friday, and the two discussed marijuana reform, among other issues.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Video: Missouri Police Search Cancer Patient’s Bags For Marijuana In Hospital Room
content: Three police officers in Missouri went to a hospital and searched through the belongings of a man with stage-four pancreatic cancer in a fruitless attempt to find marijuana on Wednesday.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Senators Are Angry That Marijuana Sentences Are Longer Than Paul Manafort’s
content: Repeatedly defraud financial institutions and the government? Get 47 months in prison.
author: Kyle Jaeger
